Our family of TLE499x linear Hall ICs is tailored to the needs of highly accurate angular and linear position detection and current measurement applications.
Each product measures the vertical component of a magnetic field and outputs a signal that is directly proportional to the magnetic field. These programmable linear Hall sensors come with different interface options.

label: Magnetic Current Sensor
definition: A high-precision current sensor for industrial applications based on Infoneon proven Hall technology. The core-less concept significantly reduces footprint compared with existing solutions. Infineon´s TLI4970 is an easy-to-use, fully digital solution that does not require external calibration or additional parts such as A/D converters, 0 pAmps or reference voltage. It thus significantly reduces overall implementation effort as well as PCB space and cost.

label: Magnetic Current Sensor
definition: A magnetic current sensor is a sensor which measures magnetic current.

label: Magnetic Position Sensor
definition: A magnetic position sensor is a sensor which measures magnetic positions.

label: Magnetic Speed Sensor
definition: The  magnetic speed sensors are designed to measure speed in safety and powertrain applications such as speedometers, ABS, camshafts/crankshafts and automatic transmissions. They are also used in similar applications in the industrial sector. The sensors use a ferromagnetic gear tooth or encoder structure to measure linear or rotational speed and position.

label: Main Application
definition: An application area on medium level (corresponing to application level 2) which can have several sub application levels (sub application) and can be assigned to super application levels (industry)

label: Main Power Device Type
definition: Each motor control and drive solution has a main power device type. Main power device type can be an "IGBT", "MOSFET" or "Relay".

label: Microcontroller
definition: A semiconductor product which is used as microcontroller

label: Microphone
definition: The highly performing MEMS Microphones will enable the next performance level of voice user interfaces, audio recording and active noise cancellation. Infineon’s Dual Backplate (DBP) MEMS technology provides crystal clear (SNR), distortion free (THD) audio signals.

label: Motor Control And Drive Solution
definition: A motor control and drive solution is a semiconductor solution which function is to drive and control a motor.

label: Motor Control And Drive Solution With DC Link Voltage 155.0
definition: Motor control and drive solution with DC link voltage equal to 155.0.

label: Motor Control And Drive Solution With Electric Power Max 200.0
definition: Motor control and drive solution with maximum electric power equal to 200.0.

label: Motor Control And Drive Solution With Industrial Qualification
definition: Motor control and drive solution with a industrial qualification.

label: Motor Control And Drive Solution With Sensor
definition: Motor control and drive solution with sensor

label: Motor Control And Drive Solution Without Sensor
definition: Motor control and drive solution without a sensor

label: Motor Type
definition: Each motor control and drive solution has a motor type. The different motor types that exist are "brushed DC", "induction", "permanent magnet stepper", "PMSM BLDC" and "switched reluctance".

label: Mounting Style
definition: Each sensor has a specific mounting style. A mounting style can either be a "SMDSMT" or "Through Hole".

label: OPN Status
definition: This status determines the OPN status of a product. The OPN status of a product can either be "active", "active and preferred", "discontinued" and "not for new design".

label: Packing Type
definition: A packing type describes how products/solutions are packed for shipping. There are different packing types, like "Ammo Pack", "Tape and Reel", "Tray" and "Tube".

label: Physical Product
definition: A physical product is something that is produced with effort (e.g. by mechanical or industrial processes) and sold to a customer. A physical product is tangible.

label: Pressure Sensor
definition: A pressure sensor is a sensor which measures pressure.

label: Price Indication
definition: A price indication helps the customer to evaluate the price of an item. A price indication can be "high", "low", or "medium".

label: Product
definition: A product is something that is produced with effort (e.g. by mechanical or industrial processes) and sold to a customer. A product is either tangible (physical product) or intangible (service).

label: Product
definition: A solution is a combination of products which is sold to a customer. Thereby, a solution solves a problem or fulfills a customer need.

label: Product Line
definition: A product line is an organizational unit that can be assigned to a business line and directly owns/is responsible for products.

label: Qualification
definition: If a product/solution has a certain qualification, the product/solution fulfills the standards of this certain industry.

label: Radar
definition: Infineon’s range of radar offerings provide unique benefits not possible with traditional motion sensing technology. Whether you require increased range coverage for outdoor lighting or a small form factor solution to enable soft landing in your multicopter our radar provides you with the ability to make your motion sensing applications perform in a way previously not possible. The BGT24M/L family is the largest and highest integrated 24GHz ISM band radar transceiver family currently in the market, providing a range of different transmitter and receiver channel configurations, supporting different application requirements. the sensor allows a Long range distance detection of moving objects up to 30 m and a wide range speed detection up to more than ±100 km/h.

label: RoHS Compliant Status
definition: This status determines whether a product is RoHS compliant or not.

label: Semiconductor Product
definition: A semiconductor product is a physical product that is produced and sold within the semiconductor industry.

label: Semiconductor Product Status
definition: A semiconductor product can have different product states which describe the product characteristics more closely.

label: Semiconductor Solution
definition: A semiconductor solution is combination of semiconductor products and is sold within the seminconductor industry.

label: Sensing Type
definition: The sensing type of a semiconductor solution determines whether a semiconductor solution contains a sensor ("WithSensor") or not ("WithoutSensor).

label: Sensor
definition: A semiconductor product which is used as sensor

label: Sensor Main Application
definition: An application area on medium level (corresponing to application level 2) for sensors which can have several sub application levels (sensor sub application)

label: Sensor Sub Application
definition: An application area on lowest level (corresponing to application level 3) for sensors which can be assigned to super application levels (sensor main application)

label: Smart Driver
definition: A semiconductor product which is used as smart driver

label: Solution
definition: A solution is a combination of products which is produced or assembled by an organization. Further, a solution is sold to a customer and solves a specific problem / fulfills a specific need.

label: Sub Application
definition: An application area on lowest level (corresponing to application level 3) which can be assigned to super application levels (main application)

label: Topology
definition: Topology describes the arrangement and the amount of chips in a semiconductor solution. A toplogy can be "3 phase", "half bridge", "h-bridge", "high side", "low side" and "relay".

label: 3D Magnetic Sensor
definition:
Capable of measuring 3D, linear and rotational movement. The sensor realizes an accurate three-dimensional sensing with extremely low power consumption. Capable of detecting the magnetic field in the x, y, and z-direction, the sensor is ideally suited for the measurement
of linear, rotation or 3 dimensional movements.

label: Category
definition: Categorizes the project in a big, medium or small project. Usually according the project size.

label: Central Function
definition: Large companies have central fuctions like the Finance or corporate suppyl chain department.

label: Certification
definition: An official document, as proof that something has happened or been done

label: Company Project
definition: Projects that are or have been developed using our methodology, based on the IPMA standard.

label: Division
definition: Hierarchical structure of an organization. For example ATV, DDS, ICP...

label: Project
definition: Achievement of the project objective requires these deliverables to conform to specific requirements, including multiple constraints such as time, cost, resources and quality standards or requirements.

label: Project
definition: ​Projects are a way to deliver value to an organization. A project is defined as a unique, temporary, multi-disciplinary and organized endeavor to realize agreed deliverables within predefined requirements and constraints.

label: Project Manager
definition: Project managers have the responsibility of the planning, procurement and execution of a project, in any undertaking that has a defined scope, defined start and a defined finish; regardless of industry.

label: Project Owner
definition: Defines BP for target achievement.

label: Project Status
definition: The current status of the project

label: Project Team Members
definition: Project team members are the individuals who actively work on one or more phases of the project.

label: Region
definition: Large companies divide their activites in regions, like in America, Greater China, SEA (South East Asia), Europe and ROW (rest of World).

label: Role
definition: Defines the responsibilities assumed by an individual.

label: Sub Project
definition: A project within a larger project.

label: Task
definition: A piece of work to be done or undertaken.

label: Training
definition: The process of learning the skills you need to do a particular job or activity

label: Work Package
definition: A work package is a group of related tasks within a project.

label: AND
definition:
All incoming pathways required to proceed along the flow
All outgoing pathways must be followed
Used to divide/rejoin tasks/flows which happen in parallel with another, rather than in a strict sequence

label: AND
definition: All outgoing process paths must be followed.

label: AND
definition: The connector is responsible for splitting the control flow in at least two different branches, which are executed parallely where all branches must be followed.

label: Application System Type
definition: An application system type classifies individual application systems which have exactly the same technological properties. Process steps might be supported by application systems. Object describe IT systems (library for IT systems available).

label: Business Process
definition: A Business Process (BP) consists of a series of value-creating activities that reach the performance expected by customers and fulfill goals derived from the business strategy.

label: Business Process Activity
definition: A Business Process (BP) Activity is a part of a Business Process containing one or more sub Business Processes or a Process Flow.

label: Business Process Flow
definition:
An EPC describes a Business Process Flow, which is a sequence of required tasks to create specified outputs using defined inputs.
A Business Process Flow is a sequence of required tasks to create specified outputs using defined inputs.

label: Business Process Landscape
definition: A Business Process Landscape (BP_Landscape) is a detailed overview of a specific Core- or Enabler Process.

label: Company Process Framework
definition: IPF is the structured overview of all IFX Core and Enabler Processes. It contains 4 Core Processes and 6 Enabler Processes.

label: Computer Hardware
definition: Physical equipment that makes up a computer system, such as circuit boards, keyboard and mouse, monitor, printer, power supply, storage devices. Contrasts with software.

label: Connector
definition: A connector determines the behavior of the process in case its control ?ow is split up into or joined from several execution branches.

label: End Event
definition: Denotes the event element that stands at the end of a branch in the process flow and thus, ends the process flow branch or the total process.

label: Environmental Data
definition: Additional information to a process like work schedule, production plans, etc.

label: Event
definition: An event illustrates the fact that a process object has taken on a business relevant state influencing the further procedure of a process. Unlike a function, which is a time consuming occurrence, an event is related to one point in time. Therefore, it is used to describe an event or status in the process flow. The object is mandatory for: EPC start and EPC end or after x (xor), v (or).

label: Event
definition: The event is a passive element since it represents a change of state but does not cause it. Furthermore it can characterize the conditions and the results of an activity, which in turn triggers the next function. An event with no incoming arc is called start event, while an event with no outgoing arc is called end event.

label: Function
definition: The function type represents several action elements as task, process interfaces or business process activities.

label: Function
definition: They are the active elements of an EPC that represent the activities of a modelled process and again raise events upon completion. The extended event driven process chain expands the semantic of functions, since they may be associated with the organizational unit performing the function or the data needed and created as output by the function.

label: Function Object
definition: In IndustryPrint 5, function objects are used to model the decomposition of a process.

label: Human Output
definition: Human being that puts effort in the processing of a process step (function). It belongs to the organizational unit that is responsible for the specific process step.

label: Input
definition: Item external to a system (such as a process) that is transformed by the system (usually together with one or more other items) to become an output.

label: Join Rule
definition: Rule element that unites the control flow after being split into several branches. Has several incoming paths (at least two) and one outgoing.

label: Machine Resource
definition: Semi or fully automated device that magnifies human physical and/or mental capabilities in performing one or more operations.

label: Material
definition: The matter from which something can be made. Material can include but is not limited to raw and processed material, components, parts, assemblies, sub-assemblies, fuels, lubricants, coolants, cleaning agents, and small tools and accessories that may be consumed directly or indirectly.

label: Model
definition: One striking commonality between EPC meta models is the Process. One process may contain an unlimited number of elements, but a process element is always linked to a specific process. If a process contains an interface, it is always linked to one specific process and represents a refinement of a normal function.

label: Model
definition: To graphically depict functional and process decomposition, function objects are diagramed on models in IndustryPrint 5.

label: Model Element
definition: An EPC model element is part of the EPC meta model and can be represented by a Function, an Event, an Operator, a Process Interface.

label: Model Element
definition: Represents an object in the EPC model. Includes all elements used in the modelling procedure of an EPC diagram.

label: Model Element
definition: Represents process flow elements except for modelling function objects.

label: Modelling Function Object
definition: Function objects are used to model the decomposition of the process flow.

label: OR
definition: At least one of the possible process paths must be followed.

label: OR
definition: It is responsible for splitting the control flow up in at least two different branches, due to an nonexclusive choice where one or several branches can be followed.

label: OR
definition:
One or more incoming pathways required to proceed along the flow
One or more outgoing pathways must be followed
Used only when neither XOR nor AND can be used to better illustrate flow
Has the weakest logic and should be used as sparingly as absolutely possible

label: Other Services
definition: Collection of other services used as input to a production process or which are created during a production process.

label: Output
definition: The amount of energy, work, goods, or services produced by a machine, factory, company, or an individual in a period.

label: Process
definition: A collection of subprocesses that meet a specific business objective. E.g. Perform Sourcing or Purchase Materials and Services

label: Process Diagram
definition: The first level of process decomposition that is comprised of subprocesses that depict a business objective.

label: Process Group
definition: A set of a processes covering a single business area. Usually under the ownership of one business process owner and correlates to one module. E.g. Procurement

label: Process Group Map
definition: A set of a processes covering a single business area. Usually under the ownership of one business process owner and aligning with a function.

label: Process Interface
definition: Process Interfaces connect several process models on the same Process hierarchical levelby linking the EPCs according to their shared events (also known as "horizontal navigation"). They thus facilitate process structuring and navigation by keeping models concise

label: Process Interface
definition:
Process interfaces connect several process models on the same process hierarchical level by linking the EPCs according to their shared events (also known as "horizontal navigation"). They thus facilitate process structuring and navigation by keeping models concise and easy-to-read.
Functionality: Jump function to next process (e.g. EPC, VAC), typically at the end of process branches. In the EPC flow there is an Event directly before.

label: Process Type
definition: A set of core and enabler processes of Infineon on Level 0 (highest level). This level helps helps organizing project work/ development and represents a single track in the oneSAP project. It is based on a Deloitte standard which was adapted to Infineon's needs.

label: Process Type Map
definition: A set of process types and related process groups that define the enterprise for a particular industry/sector.

label: Role
definition: Business Role (Person) that performs task.

label: Role
definition: Object to describe the role. Type of responsibility is defined by the linkage between function or activity and role. IFX options: carries out, contribute, must be informed.

label: Rule
definition: Rules allow to model alternative, exclusive alternative and parallel process flows.

label: Screen
definition: A transaction in SAP is described as a screen. Here, they represent the actions undertaken in the application SAP to perform a function in a process flow.

label: Split Rule
definition: Rule element that splits the control flow into several branches. Has one incoming path and several (at least two) outgoing paths.

label: Start Event
definition: Denotes the event that stands at the beginning of a branch in the process flow and thus, triggers the execution of this branch or the total process.

label: Structural Function Object
definition: Function objects are used to model the decomposition of the structure of a process.

label: Subprocess
definition: A grouping of related tasks that create an output within the larger objective of the subprocess. E.g. Create and Maintain Purchase Orders

label: Subprocess Diagram
definition: The second and lowest level of process decomposition that is comprised of tasks that depict the role-based activities of the subprocess.

label: Task
definition: A Task is an instruction of a work package to create the output.

label: Task
definition: The lowest level of detail, a task are the activities required to execute a subprocess. A single task within a subprocess can be manual or system supported. E.g. Create Purchase Order

label: Technical Term
definition: Set up with connection to a function or activity or VAC. It can be either input or output, where the direction of the arrow describes whether it is an input or an output. Set up of a connection is not mandatory.

label: Technical Term Input Element
definition: Denotes the input element to a function in the process flow.

label: Technical Term Output Element
definition: Denotes the output element of a function in the process flow.

label: Value-Added Chain Diagram
definition:
A Value-Added Chain is a process that represents an element of the process chain. A process hierarchy can be realized by hierarchically structuring value chains, thus modeling business areas, process groups, business processes and business process variants using the sam notation.
House: represents enabler processes.

label: XOR
definition: Exactly one of the possible process paths must be followed.

label: XOR
definition: It is responsible for splitting the control flow in at least two different branches, due to an exclusive choice where exactly one of the branches is followed.

label: XOR
definition:
One and only one of the incoming pathways is required to proceed along the flow
One and only one of the outgoing pathways can be taken
Divide should be made with yes/no question and lines labelled only with �yes� or �no�
Gateway must therefore be named with this Yes/No question

label: Customer Part Number Specification
definition: A Customer Part Number (CPN) is the product identifier used by the customer to identify one IFX product.

label: Customer Part Number Specification
definition: In general, one CPN is equal to one Sales Product Name. Each customer will use a different CPN.

label: Die-Representative
definition: Die-Representative (DREP): supply element; where the package is not yet decided

label: Fabrication Position
definition: Fabrication Position (FPOS): product & manufacturing route; where it is produced - coarse

label: Finished Product
definition: End result of the manufacturing process

label: Non-Shippable Product
definition: Non-Shippable Products are those finished Product Numbers that are not allowed to be shipped to a given customer

label: Not Released Product
definition: Not Released Products are those finished Product Numbers that are not allowed to be shipped to any customer

label: Organization
definition: An organization is en entity comprising multiple people. In SSC, this class mainly refers to businesses.

label: Plan Position
definition: Plan Position (PPOS): capacity and demand planning element

label: Product
definition: A product is a work product that is delivered to the customer.

label: Product
definition: Any tangible output or service that is a result of a process and that is intended for delivery to a customer or end user.

label: Required for Plan
definition: Required for Plan (RfP): planning product being not capacity relevant

label: Sales Product
definition: Sellable product; It can be identified by salesProductNumber

label: Stock Keeping Unit
definition: Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) - finished product by storage location; called DC BauNumber

label: Abstract
definition:
Any Entity that cannot be located in space-time.

Example: mathematical entities: formal semantics elements, regions within dimensional spaces, etc."

label: Amplication Switching Device
definition: Should defined as its function for example: Sensor, Power Converter, Microcontroller. Then must be defined what the device it is, for exmaple: A sensing device is a device that implments sensing.

label: Application Area
definition: The different application ares that the product can be used.

label: Communication Services
definition: Industrial sector of Communication Services

label: Constant Resistance
definition: The constant degree to which a substance prevents the flow of an electric current through it

label: Consumer Discretionary
definition: Industrial sector of Consumer Discretionary

label: Consumer Staples
definition: Industrial sector of Consumer staples

label: Control Method
definition: It is the method used to turn on, turn off , increaseing, and decreasing output current/voltage.

label: Deplyment
definition: The ongoing Process of Entities (for the purposes of this ontology, mainly the Infineon device) deployed for a particular purpose. For example, a particular Sensor deployed on a Platform, or a whole network of Sensors deployed for an observation campaign. The deployment may have sub processes, such as installation, maintenance, addition, and decomissioning and removal.

label: Deployment-Related Process
definition: Place to group all the various Processes related to Deployment. For example, as well as Deployment, installation, maintenance, deployment of the further devices and the like would all be classified under DeploymentRelatedProcess.

label: Device
definition: A device is a physical piece of technology - a system in a box. Devices may of course be build of smaller devices and software components."

label: Device Configuration
definition: Device configuration can refer to either hardware or software , or the combination of both.

label: Device Element
definition: Elements that are part of a device

label: Document
definition: The document class presents those things which are, broadly conceived, "documents''. It should contain the manuals and the data sheet of the devices.

label: Electric Vehicle Charging
definition: Area that focuses on electric vehicles charging solutions

label: Electronic Components
definition: Industrial sector of Electronic Components

label: Electronic Equipment Instruments And Components
definition: Industrial sector of Electronic Equipment, Instruments and Components

label: Energy
definition: Industrial sector of Energy

label: Energy Storage
definition: Area that focuses on energy storage solutions

label: Entity
definition: Anything: real, possible, or imaginary, which some modeller wants to talk about for some purpose.

label: Financial
definition: Financial Sector

label: Geometric Dimension
definition: "Describes the Dimensions of any Physical Object (Length, Wisth, Height)"

label: Healthcare
definition: Healthcare sector

label: Height
definition: The height of an entity

label: Industrial Sector
definition:
The collection of all localized groups of enterprises that are producers of industrial commodities, in which each such group together forms the major industrial sector for the region. 'Industrial commodities' includes MechanicalDevices and basic industrial materials. Examples include 'the world industrial sector', the 'industrial sector of China'. The Chinese water pump industry would not be an exemplar of IndustrialEconomicSector but would rather be a sub-industry (see subIndustries) of it. On the other hand, chinese water pump manufacturers would be considered groupMembers of 'the industrial sector of China'.

This classification is done by The Global Industry Classification Standard (GICS) is an industry taxonomy developed in 1999 by MSCI and Standard & Poor's (S&P) for use by the global financial community. The GICS structure consists of 11 sectors, 24 industry groups, 68 industries and 157 sub-industries[1] into which S&P has categorized all major public companies

label: Industrials
definition: Industrial sectors

label: Information Entity
definition: A piece of information, be it concretely realized or not.

label: Information Object
definition: A piece of information, such as a musical composition, a text, a word, a picture, independently from how it is concretely realized.

label: Information Technology
definition: Industrial sector of Information Technology

label: Interface
definition: A common boundary or interconnection between systems, equipment, concepts, or human beings

label: Junction Temperature
definition: The highest operating temperature of the actual semiconductor

label: Lenght
definition: The length of an entity

label: Materials
definition: Industrial sector of Materials

label: Maximum Junction Temperature
definition: Is specified in the part's datasheet and is used when calculating the necessary case-to-ambient thermal resistance for a given power dissipation.

label: Microcontroller
definition: Industrial sector of Microcontrollers

label: Negative (-)
definition: Is the negative difference in electric potential between two points

label: Object
definition: Any physical, social, or mental object, or a substance

label: Package
definition: A package is the housing for a chip (or several chips) and provides electrical contacts. It is an interconnect in between chip-pads and the interface to the PCB board. A package is characterized by its outline (drawing) and its materials.

label: Physical Object
definition: Any physical object

label: Platform
definition:
An Entity to which other Entities can be attached - particularly semiconductor products and other platforms.

Example: A post might act as the platform, a body might act as a platform for an attached device.

label: Positive (+)
definition: Is the positive difference in electric potential between two points

label: Power Converter
definition: Industrial sector of Power Converters

label: Price
definition: The element of an entity

label: Process
definition: A process has an output and possibly inputs, and for a compositive process, describes the temporal and dataflow dependencies and relationships amongst its parts.

label: Process Input
definition: Any information that is provided a Procedure for its use.

label: Process Output
definition: Any information that is reported from a Procedure.

label: Product
definition:
The superclass of all classes describing products or services types, either by nature or purpose. Examples for such subclasses are "TV set", "vacuum cleaner", etc. An instance of this class can be either an actual product or service (gr:Individual), a placeholder instance for unknown instances of a mass-produced commodity (gr:SomeItems), or a model / prototype specification (gr:ProductOrServiceModel). When in doubt, use gr:SomeItems. Examples:
a) MyCellphone123, i.e. my personal, tangible cell phone (gr:Individual)
b) Siemens1234, i.e. the Siemens cell phone make and model 1234 (gr:ProductOrServiceModel)
c) dummyCellPhone123 as a placeholder for actual instances of a certain kind of cell phones (gr:SomeItems)

label: Property
definition: Any attribute of an entity

label: Quality
definition: Any aspect of an Entity (but not a part of it), which cannot exist without that Entity. For example, the way the surface of a specific PhysicalObject looks like is a Quality, while the encoding of that Quality into e.g. a PhysicalAttribute should be modeled as a Region. From the design viewpoint, the Quality-Region distinction is useful only when individual aspects of an Entity are considered in a domain of discourse. For example, in an automotive context, it would be irrelevant to consider the aspects of car windows for a specific car, unless the factory wants to check a specific window against design parameters (anomaly detection). On the other hand, in an antiques context, the individual aspects for a specific piece of furniture are a major focus of attention, and may constitute the actual added value, because the design parameters for old furniture are often not fixed, and may not be viewed as 'anomalies'.

label: Real Estate
definition: Real Estate sector

label: Resistance
definition: The degree to which a substance prevents the flow of an electric current through it

label: Semiconductor Product Data Sheet
definition: Data sheet of a semiconductor product (its name), SiC MOSFET Data Sheet

label: Semiconductors
definition: Industrial sector of Semiconductors

label: Semiconductors And Semiconductor Equipment
definition: Industrial sector of Semiconductors and Semiconductor Equipment

label: Sensors
definition: Industrial sector of Sensors

label: SiC MOSFET
definition: Silicon Carbide Metal Oxide Semiconductor Field Effect Transistor (SiC MOSFET): It is a transistor: It is used for switching or amplifying the electronics signals or electric power.

label: Situation
definition: A view, consistent with ('satisfying') a Description, on a set of entities. It can also be seen as a 'relational context' created by an observer on the basis of a 'frame' (i.e. a Description). For example, a PlanExecution is a context including some actions executed by agents according to certain parameters and expected tasks to be achieved from a Plan; a DiagnosedSituation is a context of observed entities that is interpreted on the basis of a Diagnosis, etc. Situation is also able to represent reified n-ary relations, where isSettingFor is the top-level relation for all binary projections of the n-ary relation. If used in a transformation pattern for n-ary relations, the designer should take care of creating only one subclass of Situation for each n-ary relation, otherwise the 'identification constraint' (Calvanese et al., IJCAI 2001) could be violated.

label: Social Object
definition:
Act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to an ObservableProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that proeprty was associated with.

Example: The activity of estimating the intensity of an earthquake using the Mercalli intensity scale is an Observation as is measuring the moment magnitude, i.e., the energy released by said earthquake.

label: Software And Services
definition: Industrial sector of Software and Services

label: Solar Energy
definition: Area that focuses on solar energy solutions

label: Switcher
definition: Switchers rapidly switch a series device on and off.

label: Switching Value
definition:
The value of the result of the method (procedures) of the device function. The result is an information object that encodes some value for a feature. For example:
a) If we consider the observation is the method used for sensing of the sensors, then the observation has a result which is the output of the sensor,
b) If we consider the amplification is the method used for boosting of the power converter, then the amplification has a result which is the output of the  power converter,

label: System
definition: System is a unit of abstraction for pieces of infrastructure that implements procedure. A System may have components, its subsystems, which are other systems."

label: Technology Hardware And Equipment
definition: Industrial sector of Technology Hardware and Equipment

label: The Device Output
definition: SiC MOSFET Output, the device output is a piece of information (value), the value itself being represented by an The device function value.

label: The Method Of The Device Function (Switching)
definition:
The function of the devices has a method ( Procedure to estimate or calculate a value), for example:
The Senor its function is the sensing, the sensing method is the observation
The Boost converter ( a type of the power converter) its function is boosting, the boosting method is the amplification.

Act of carrying out an (the method) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to an the methodProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that proeprty was associated with.

Example: The activity of estimating the intensity of an earthquake using the Mercalli intensity scale is an Observation as is measuring the moment magnitude, i.e., the energy released by said earthquake."

label: The Process Used In The Device Function
definition:
It is a process that results in the estimation, or calculation, of the value of a device output.
Usually it derived from the name of the device for example:
Sensor process: sensing: Sensing is a process that results in the estimation, or calculation, of the value of a phenomenon.

Boost Converter process: boosting: is a process that results in the estimation, or calculation, of the value of a amplified voltage.

label: Utilities
definition: Utilities sector

label: Variable Resistance
definition: The variable degree to which a substance prevents the flow of an electric current through it

label: Voltage
definition: Is the difference in electric potential between two points

label: Voltage Controlled
definition: by applying the voltage between Gate and Sourcet o turn on, turn off the MOSFET, and  increaseing, decreasing  the MOSFET output current.

label: Weight
definition: The element of an entity

label: Width
definition: The width of an entity

label: Activity
definition: Additional lobes: Planning

label: Available Capacity
definition: : The AVAILABLE CAPACITY describes the ability of a resource within a period of time to perform activities or processes. Elmaghraby (2011) refers to this as operational capacity, i.e. the productive capacity that is obtained from the nominal capacity by subtracting the anticipated and unavoidable loss in productivity, for instance, due to machine breakdowns in a wafer fab.

label: Bill Of Material
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Bill Of Material
definition: A BILL OF MATERIALS (BOM) describes the component products used to make another product. Substitution, often associated with binning, is based on the possibility that alternative items might be used to finish a process step.

label: Bin
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Binning
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Binning
definition: BINNING refers to the process of testing and categorizing parts against defined measures and sort them into different bins (Degbotse 2013). Each bin belongs to certain levels of defined measures (e.g. chip speed, current, voltage, energy consumption). Binning is often combined with SUBSTITUTION.

label: Capacity
definition: CAPACITY with respect to the Domain Semiconductor and Supply Chains Containing Semiconductor is the maximum number of products or a group of products a machine or a group of machines can produce. As soon as a machine has free capacity: 1. all lots which belongs to a priority class have to be dispatched immediately according to their priority rank.

label: Criteria
definition: Typical CRITERIA are maximization, minimization, i.e. if an optimization problem is considered, or larger or smaller than a prescribed value of the certain performance measure, a so-called target, i.e. if a satisfaction problem is solved. In a multi-criteria setting, the dominance concept for plans is of interest.

label: Decision Maker Type
definition: We distinguish human decision-makers (human DECISION-MAKING UNITS) from fully automated DECISION-MAKING UNITS where computers make fully automated decisions. Between these two extremes there are semi-automated decisions, where a computer provides several decision alternatives and a human decision-maker chooses among them. Note that the decision-maker type can change over time.

label: Decision Making Initiative
definition: We distinguish fully autonomous DECISION-MAKING UNITS from DECISION-MAKING UNITS where the decision-making activities are triggered by other DECISION-MAKING UNITS. Note that the decision-making initiative can change over time in a situation-dependent manner.

label: Decision Making Unit
definition: The DECISION-MAKING UNIT specifies an instance that makes decisions.

label: Decison Making Unit Character
definition: In an ANTAGO¬NISTIC SETTING, the different DECISION-MAKING UNITS try to meet their own objectives which are in conflict. In a non-antagonistic setting, the DECISION-MAKING UNITS do not exploit their private knowledge in an opportunistic way.

label: Demand
definition: DEMAND is a supply chain or production request for a specific product, product group or service. Either demand exists explicitly in form of customer need (e.g. orders or EDI forecast) or implicitly as expected customer need.

label: Distributed Hierarchical Situation
definition: In this situation, edges referring to instructions and reactions are possible.

label: Edge
definition: EDGE in the supply chain refers to the use of edge computing technologies to process data closer to where it is generated—such as warehouses, factories, vehicles or others —rather than relying on centralized cloud systems. By enabling real-time data analysis and decision-making at the "edge" of the network, companies can reduce latency, enhance operational responsiveness, and improve visibility across the supply chain.

label: Frozen Fence
definition: FROZEN FENCE is used to set a frozen interval in which decision making is not allowed, or a defined exception, to change the previously determined values.

label: Heterarchical Situation
definition: All the vertices have level 1.

label: Hierarchical Situation
definition: HIERARCHICAL SITUATION refers to the structured, multi-level arrangement of entities, processes, or decision-making authority within the supply chain. It outlines e.g. how different layers—such as suppliers, manufacturers, distributors, and retailers—interact based on levels of control, responsibility, and information flow.

label: In-Transit Inventory
definition: The IN-TRANSIT INVENTORY describes the quantity of a certain product that is shipped from one location to another. This quantity has left the inventory of one location, but has not yet been received into the inventory of the receiving location.

label: Inventory
definition: INVENTORY refers to the stock of goods, materials, and components that a business holds for the purpose of production, resale, or operational use. It is a key asset in supply chain and financial management, directly impacting a company's ability to meet customer demand, manage costs, and generate revenue.

label: Inventory Policy
definition: INVENTORY POLICY is a set of rules that guide how much stock is needed to balance supply with demand. It helps prevent shortages or excess inventory while controlling costs.

label: Location
definition:
LOCATION refers to a physical or virtual place where an action, process, or activity occurs, playing a critical role in the execution of tasks within the supply chain, production, and planning systems.

•	Logistics perspective: A location signifies the point where responsibility, ownership, or risk transitions between parties during the transfer of goods or services.
•	Demand Fulfillment Perspective: A location represents the origin or destination of demand-related processes, such as the point of product dispatch, delivery to customers, or storage of inventory to meet customer needs.
•	Planning Perspective: Locations are key inputs for planning activities, representing the physical sites or nodes in the supply chain (e.g., factories, warehouses, or distribution centers) where resources, capacity, or inventory must be allocated.
•	Semiconductor Production Perspective: In manufacturing, a location indicates a specific site where production steps take place, such as fabrication, assembly, or testing.

LOCATIONS are fundamental to managing supply chain efficiency, tracking material flow, coordinating production processes, and ensuring timely fulfillment of customer orders.

label: Lot Sizing Rule
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Lot Sizing Rule
definition: A LOT SIZING RULE defines a rule to specify the lot size for a specific part. The lot size on the other hand defines the number of pieces belonging to a part. The lot size is the result of applying lot sizing rules.

label: Macro Operation
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Order
definition: An ORDER contains at least one order position. An ORDER has an order type and is associated to DEMAND.

label: Owner
definition: An OWNER refers to the individual, team, or entity that holds primary responsibility for a specific asset, process, task, or decision within an organization or project.

label: Part
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Part
definition: A PART represents a physical instance of a product in the manufacturing process. It therefore realizes a product. A part moves through the system and is manufactured according to its product specification. A part is associated to exactly one product. During the production process it is typically tested several times. The binning rules of the associated product specification can be applied to the respective part. A part can be substituted by another part according to the associated product specification

label: Performance Measure
definition: PERFORMANCE MEASURE is defined by a calculation procedure. Performance measures can be blended using weights to express the importance of the different measures.

label: Plan
definition: A PLAN is an activity specification with an intended purpose.

label: Plan Execution
definition: A PLAN EXECUTION is related to performing the activities according to a PLAN either directly in the base system, for instance, releasing lots into a wafer fab, or as instructions for another DECISION-MAKING UNIT.

label: Planning Approach
definition: PLANNING APPROACH is a specific planning algorithm which is used in a deticated planning process.

label: Planning Constraint
definition:
In the planning domain a PLANNING CONSTRAINTS is often referred to capacity limitation, which limit the quantities that can be produced on an equipment or a fab for a certain product or product groups. Other Constraints can be workforce or material. Constraints can be temporary and can change. 
Most popular academic definition: A PLANNING CONSTRAINT restricts the action space. This space is formed by alternative actions that are a result of the planning decisions (Schneeweis 2003).

label: Planning Decision
definition: The PLANNING DECISIONS is the best choice out of options, determined by the DECISION-MAKING UNIT.

label: Planning Function
definition: PLANNING FUNCTION describes the different functions and its properies follwing the supply chain planning matrix.

label: Planning Instance
definition: A PLANNING INSTANCE specifies the PLANNING OBJECTS and the values of related PLANNING CONSTRAINTS that form the basis for a planning decision.

label: Planning Object
definition: A PLANNING OBJECT specifies what has to be planned as an atomic unit. A single PLANNING OBJECT typically represents a quantity of a certain product or product aggregate to be released or completed within a certain period in a certain node of the semiconductor supply chain. Other PLANNING OBJECTS can be orders or lots. Values are assigned to the attributes of a PLANNING OBJECT as a result of a planning decision.

label: Planning Process
definition: The PLANNING PROCESS specifies under which circumstances which (re)planning activities are performed by a DECISION-MAKING UNIT.

label: Planning Purpose
definition: The PLANNING PURPOSE specifies the objectives of a certain planning activity. It is given by a set of performance measures that are related to a set of PLANNING OBJECTS.

label: Planning Situation
definition: The PLANNING SITUATION describes the organization of several DECISION-MAKING UNITS and also its environment.

label: Process
definition: A PROCESS is a collection of subprocesses that meet a specific business objective. E.g. Perform Sourcing or Purchase Materials and Services. A production PROCESS specifies a method of making a product at a location. The process is expressed at a coarse level of granularity suitable for use in production planning.

label: Product
definition: A PRODUCT is a good that fulfills a prescribed set of requirements (for instance, form, fit, and function). A set of alternative BOMs might be associated with each product. The manufacturing process is complicated by binning and substitution (in production). Binning refers to the process that an item can become one of several products based on tested levels of performance, for instance, speed.

label: Product Aggregate
definition: A PRODUCT AGGREGATE combines individual products into a product group, called a PRODUCT AGGREGATE. This results in a reduction of complexity, which enables a better overview.

label: Product Hierarchy
definition: A PRODUCT HIERARCHY characterizes the top-down and bottom-up relationship between different product aggregates. It organizes the product aggregates according to defined criteria. A product aggregate is used to group different products based on certain criteria. The grouping criteria depends often on the planning purpose (e.g. controlling, production). It is a certain view on a set of products.

label: Projected WIP
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Projected WIP
definition: The PROJECTED WIP describes the quantity of a certain product that is anticipated to be received into inventory at a particular location at a particular time.

label: Replanning Degree
definition: REPLANNING DEGREE is the degree of change between an updated plan and a previous plan.

label: Resource
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Resource Availability Constraints
definition: This type of constraints has an impact on the assignment of activities to RESOURCES and to START/END TIMES to ACTIVITIES.

label: Resource Compatibility Constraints
definition: This type of constraints ensures that only allowed activities are performed using a given RESOURCE.

label: Route
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Semi Automated
definition: Between these two extremes there are semi-automated decisions, where a computer provides several decision alternatives and a human decision-maker chooses among them.

label: Strict_Hierarchical_Situation
definition: There are only edges between vertices of level k and vertices of level k-1, where k≥2.

label: Substitution
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Substitution
definition: SUBSTITUTION refers to using alternative parts. Depending on the product, each one could be replaced by using specific alternatives at the same stage of production, e.g. final product, raw material, or semi-finished products (Degbotse 2013) in order to complete a manufacturing step or fulfill a customer order.

label: Supply Information
definition: SUPPLY INFORMATION provides information of the used and unused supply of a supply chain network.

label: Target
definition: TARGETS are prescribed values for the different performance measures.

label: Temporal-Constraints
definition: This type of constraints restricts the values of temporal attributes, modeled by the property TIME, that belong to PLANNING OBJECTS. For instance, there might be a minimum amount of time between two consecutive operations of a certain product.

label: Trigger
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Trigger
definition: A mechanism that initiates an action when an event occurs such as reaching a certain time or date or upon receiving some type of input. A trigger generally causes a program routine to be executed.

label: Vertex
definition: VERTEX plays a crucial role in the financial and compliance side of the supply chain. Its solutions help businesses calculate, manage, and report indirect taxes (like sales tax, VAT, and GST) at the relevant point in the supply chain, from procurement to distribution.

label: Yield
definition: Additional lobe: Planning

label: Yield
definition: YIELD could be the fraction (percentage) of good dies resulting from total dies released.

label: Admin Shell
definition: Andmin Shell represents and describes an asset elecrtonically in a standardized manner

label: Asset
definition: Every I4.0-component has to represent an entity. The entity can be physical or digital asset. The definition makes it possible to classify assets without integrated and accessible computers as I4.0-component, if the digital representation of the asset is accessible on a separate computer.

label: Date
definition: A numbered day in a month, often given with a combination of the name of the day, the month, and the year

label: Dimension
definition: Abstract class to describe the three different dimensions of RAMI4.0

label: Energy Efficiency
definition: Specifies some details regarding energy efficiency. These can also be supplied by sensors.

label: I 4.0 Component
definition: Globally uniquely identifiable participant with communication capability consisting of administration shell and asset within an I4.0 system.

label: MES Connection
definition: Connects the station to a higher-level MES system via a small number of properties. Specifies whether the station is producing, ready for production, has a fault or is undergoing maintenance, for example.

label: Machine
definition: A machine is ordered, designed, commissioned, operated, serviced, converted and recycled.

label: Measure
definition: To discover the exact size or amount of something

label: RAMI Hierarchy Level Dimension
definition: It describes the functional classification of various circumstances within Industrie 4.0. For classification within a factory, this axis of the reference architecture(layers) follows the IEC 62264 Standard.

label: RAMI IT Layer Dimension
definition: The six layers on the vertical axis describe the decomposition of a machine into its properties, structured layer by layer, i.e., the virtual mapping of a machine. Such representations originate from information and communication technology, where properties of complex systems are commonly broken down into layers.

label: RAMI Life Cycle Dimension
definition: It describes the different Life Cycle and Value Stream layers for the RAMI model according to the IEC 62890 Standard.

label: Sensor
definition: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.

label: Sensor Measurement
definition: Measurement performed by a sensor

label: Standard
definition: Standards that are used to describe the actual I4.0 Asset. Defined in the STO ontology

label: Standard Organization
definition: Standards organisations that prepares and publishes International Standards for all electrical, electronic and related technologies

label: Standard Version
definition: Most commonly used version

label: Structure
definition: The way in which the parts of a system or object are arranged or organized, or a system arranged in this way

label: Submodel
definition: Describe the different types of data related to the I4.0 asset

label: Used Date
definition: Date uded by particular standard

label: Version
definition: A particular form of something that is slightly different from other forms of the same thing

label: View
definition: Different views associated to the Administration Shell via the Submodels

label: Aggregated Capacity
definition: The AGGREGATED CAPACITY GROUP (ACG) combines products that are interchangeable in production resources (e.g. can be produced on the same equipment) and having the same capacity consumption. Using an ACG provides flexibility in a way of switching demands of this products within this ACG.

label: Allocated Available To Promise
definition: The AATP (Allocated Available To Promise) is this part of the ATP (Available To Promise) which is already located to a certain customer(group) or a region.

label: Available To Promise
definition: The ATP (Available to promise) is todays and upcoming Availability of products for demand fulfillment and order promising.

label: Bottleneck Resource
definition: A bottleneck resource is an obstacle to smooth flow in a process.

label: Capacity Bottleneck
definition: A CAPACITY BOTTLENECK describes a machine or another element, which constrains the flow of a product. The throughput of the Capacity Bottlenecks define the throughput of a production line.

label: Confirmation
definition: A CONFIRMATION is an order acknowledgement with a due date from the supplier.

label: Consignment Order
definition:
Consignment Stock is a logistics concept where the supplier (Vendor) owned goods are stored at a customer location.

The supplier (Vendor) is responsible to maintain his stock within a defined min/max level.

label: Customer
definition:
CUSTOMER is a person, organization, or business entity that generates demand by placing an order or making a request for a specific product or service. A customer may also fulfill their obligations by facilitating payment for the goods or services received.

Customers can be categorized into two main types: 
•	External Customers: Entities outside the organization that purchase goods or services, often governed by agreements like Incoterms.
•	Internal Customers: Stakeholders or departments within the organization that raise internal demand for products or services to support internal processes.

A customer interacts with the organization through actions such as order placement, demand generation, and the completion of financial transactions. Customers are central to both demand creation in the supply chain and the fulfillment processes that ensure the delivery of goods or services.

label: Customer Logistics Management Representative
definition: A CUSTOMER LOGISTICS MANAGEMENT REPRESENTATIVE (CLM) is a typical name for one “face” to the customer, taking care of all customers supply chain topics. He/she is responsible for the demand fulfilment process – Usage of ATP. It is his/her task to ensure in-time delivery to customers based on orders and forecasts. He/she is usually also taking care of forecast in a midterm time horizon (typical for that is the EDI FORECAST)

label: DC
definition: A DC Facility represents a finished goods store.

label: Die Bank
definition: A die bank is an area in production where (usually) tested wafers are stored waiting for disposition and further production.

label: EDI Forecast
definition: The EDI Forecast Universe is a Data Mart that was started in 2010 (?) to support Forecast Accuracy  analysis

label: Forecast
definition: Forecast is an unconstrained prospect about the customer future demand.

label: Marketing Demand
definition: MARKETING DEMAND is a supply chain or production request for a specific product, product group or service, coming from the market. Either demand exists explicitly in form of customer need (e.g. orders or EDI forecast) or implicitly as expected customer need.

label: Max Stock
definition: The amount of inventory which should not be exceeded. The limit is normally determined after considering storage space of the facilities, how quickly inventory is sold or used, cost of insurance on inventory, and the risk of inventory becoming outdated before it is used.

label: Min Stock
definition: The minimum level of inventory is a kind of a precautionary level of inventory which indicates that the delivery of raw materials or merchandise may take more than the normal lead time.

label: Min Stock
definition: The minimum level of stock is a certain predetermined minimum quantity of raw materials or product inventory which should always be available in stock in the normal course of business.

label: nEWs
definition: A nEW is a negative Early Warning and it means that a new customer order confirmation is worse (later order confirmation date) than the previous order confirmation. nEWs is the plural of nEW.

label: Open Order Book
definition: An OPEN ORDER BOOK is a business's list of open, unshipped, customer orders, normally time-phased and valued at actual individual order prices, that may include margin and profitability analysis.

label: Operational Demand
definition: OPERATIONAL DEMAND is a supply chain or production request for a specific product, product group or service, coming from company intern business division. Either demand exists explicitly in form of customer need (e.g. orders or EDI forecast) or implicitly as expected customer need.OPERATIONAL DEMAND is a supply chain or production request for a specific product, product group or service, coming from company intern business division. Either demand exists explicitly in form of customer need (e.g. orders or EDI forecast) or implicitly as expected customer need.

label: Order
definition: An ORDER is a confirmation of a transaction (a receipt), which can contain multiple line items, each represented by an Offer that has been accepted by the customer.

label: Order Line Item
definition: ORDER LINE ITEM is every product on the order is referenced by a record that includes quantity and usually a customer delivery wish date, as well as a reference to which order it belongs.

label: Order Reschedule
definition: ORDER RESCHEDULE is any change in the requested order delivery date or volume in an order line is referred to as an order rescheduling.

label: Order Schedule Line
definition: ORDER SCHEDULE LINE contains all the delivery related information.

label: Prioritized Demand
definition: The PRIORITIZED DEMAND is the demand that should be covered first.

label: Prioritized Orders
definition: PRIORITIZED ORDERS are Orders that should be completed first.

label: Promise
definition: A PROMISE is the committed portion of supply by the master production schedule and material plan.

label: Resource Capacity
definition: Resource capacity planning is about comparing future resource utilization of project resources against available capacity to do work.

label: Safety Stock
definition: Describes a level of extra stock that is maintained to mitigate risk of stockouts  caused by uncertainties in supply and demand.

label: Sales Demand
definition: A SALES DEMAND is a request for a specific product or service that can have different triggers. Either demand exists explicitly in form of customer orders or implicitly as expected customer need that have to be fulfilled by the semiconductor supply chain.

label: Stocks
definition: A supply of something for use or sale

label: Supply Demand Match
definition: Supply and demand match when sufficient materials exist to cover material demand while taking available capacity into account.

label: Supply Picture
definition: A SUPPLY PICTURE is a visualization of the supply in its dimensions. Supply is the total amount of specific products that is available to customers. Supply has the dimensions quantity, time, location, product, including aggregation of all dimensions. Supply is defined as inventory or plan replenishment.

label: Target Allocation
definition: The TARGET ALLOCATION is the level of allocation planned by the company.

label: Work In Progress
definition:
Work In Progress (WIP) includes the unfinished items for products in a production process.
These items are not yet completed but either just being fabricated or waiting in a queue for further processing.

label: Bottleneck
definition: A capacity Bottleneck is defined as an equipment or multiple equipment that reflect the capacity of the whole line (either a dedicated Line or Pool sharing).

label: Capacity
definition: CAPACITY with respect to the Domain Semiconductor and Supply Chains Containing Semiconductor is the maximum number of products or a group of products a machine or a group of machines can produce. As soon as a machine has free capacity: 1. all lots which belongs to a priority class have to be dispatched immediately according to their priority rank.

label: Chemical Polishing
definition: The chemical polishing process or chemical mechanical planarization (CMP) is a process whereby a chemical reaction increases the mechanical removal rate of a material. CMP is commonly used to polish off high spots on wafers or films deposited on wafers, flattening the film or wafer, referred to as planarization. The chemical reaction that increases the mechanical removal rate is commonly tailored to provide a higher removal rate of one material versus another material. The chemical action in CMP helps to achieve higher selectivity's of one material to another than a strictly mechanical process would provide.

label: Current Work In Progress
definition: “Current WIP” entity describes the actual material distribution in the supply chain. (snapshot entity)

label: Cycle Time Commitment
definition:
The “Cycle Time Commitment” entity helps controlling the WIP
via the release plan. (strategy entity)

label: Delivery Commitment
definition: The "Delivery Commitment" directly corresponds to the release plans and cycle time commitments introduced in the corresponding entities.

label: Demand Snapshot
definition: The “Demand” entity stores redundant demand at every product level. (snapshot entity)

label: Deposition
definition: The deposition process, or chemical vapor deposition (CVD) is a process whereby a fiolm is deposited by reacting chemicals together in the gaseous or vapor phase to form a film. The gases or vapors utilized for CVD are compounds that contain the element to be deposited and that may be inducted to react with a substrate or other gas(es) to deposit a film. The CVD reactoin may be thermally activated, plasma induced, plasma enhanced CVD or activated by light in photon induced CVD.

label: Development
definition: These lots have the same maxium waiting time as standard lots, however they are put before the standard lots.

label: Diffusion
definition: Diffusion is a process whereby a substance redistributes from an area of relatively high concentration to an area of relatively low concentration due to random thermal motion. The larger the concentration gradient the faster diffusion occurs for a given temperature, conversely, the higher the temperature the faster diffusion occurs for a given concentration gradient.

label: Dry Etching
definition: Dry etching is a process whereby etching is accomplished by a reactive gas as opposed to a liquid. Dry etching techniques include plasma etch, reactive ion etch, magnetically enhanced reactive ion etch, inductively coupled plasma, electron spin resonance, etc.

label: EPA
definition: The EPA is a product identifier referring to the associated process.

label: Equipment
definition: The entity “Equipment” describes the semiconductor equipment of any equipment model. It allocates it to higher level entities and describes the behavior of the equipment. (master entity)

label: Equipment Group
definition: Each machine is allocated to a group of machines doing similar processes. The equipment groups are described and allocated in the master entity “Equipment Group”. (master entity)

label: Event Calendar
definition: In the “Event Calendar” tracing entity, certain events like planned facility shutdowns, etc. can be scheduled

label: Fabrication
definition: The “Fab” entity depicts the fab as a technological and physical production unit. (master entity)

label: Furnace
definition: Each furnace consists of two chambers with one tool in each chamber.

label: Furnace Process
definition: Sequence of interdependent and linked procedures which, at every stage, consume one or more resources (employee time, energy, machines, money) to convert inputs (data, material, parts, etc.) into outputs. These outputs then serve as inputs for the next stage until a known goal or end result is reached.

label: Hot
definition: These lots are processed after a certain maximum waiting time which is shorter than the maximum waiting time of standard lots. In general, for all classes, if there is more than one product type waiting.

label: Implantation
definition: Implantation or Ion Implantation is a technique where ions are accelerated to a higher energy and speed an injected into a semiconductor. The dominant techniques for introducing dopants into a semiconductor.

label: Lithography
definition: The lithography process is the key process in frontend. This consists of the following steps: a photo resisting layer is spun on a wafer, then exposed through the mask, then developed, then showing the effect on the open places, and then final deletion of the photo resisting material leaves only the remaining structure on the water. after some time for deposition, these steps are repeated up to 35 times.

label: Lot
definition: The Lot represents manufacturing unit (e.g. in the semicondutor industry in Frontend this often consists of 25 or 50 wafers).

label: Lot Event
definition: The Lot Event  tracing entity gives the history of lot events. e.g. Hold events, Split events, Merge events, etc. (tracing entities).

label: Lot Size
definition: A measure or quantity increment acceptable to or specified by the party offering to buy or sell. Used also as an alternative term for lot quantity.

label: Mask
definition: A transparent (glass or quartz) plate covered with an array of patterns used in making an IC. Each pattern consists of opaque and transparent areas that define the size and shape of all circuit and device elements. The mask is used to expose selected areas, and defines the areas to be processed. Masks may use emulsion, chrome, iron oxide, silicon or other material to produce the opaque areas.

label: Material Transfer Matrix
definition: A material transfer matrix estimates the duration of material from on to another equipment.

label: Operation
definition: The master entity “Operation” depicts the generic behavior of a single process step. Each operation has a foreign key relation to equipment and to route which means that the operation is required by the specific routes and requires a specific equipment. (workflow descriptive master entity)

label: Operator
definition: A user that interacts with the equipment only to the degree necessary for the equipment to perform its intended function.

label: Owner
definition: An owner is the entity that has the highest level of access authority or legal right to a system or equipment.

label: Planning Work Center
definition: Semiconductor wafers arrive at the planning work center according to a Poisson process in lots with a certain unit size. The planning work center X48- can process three different products which arrive in four different classes.

label: Plant
definition: The “Plant” entity describes the plant as a physical location of one or more fabs. The Plant belongs to a supply chain and can either be internal or external. (master entity)

label: Priority Class
definition: Each lot is characterized by a product type and a priority class. The priority classes are listed as follows: development, hot, productive, rocket and timecoupling.

label: Process
definition: Sequence of interdependent and linked procedures which, at every stage, consume one or more resources (employee time, energy, machines, money) to convert inputs (data, material, parts, etc.) into outputs. These outputs then serve as inputs for the next stage until a known goal or end result is reached.

label: Process
definition: Additional lobe: Semicondutor Development

label: Process Class
definition: A Process Class is the second hierarchy level in the Technology Catalogue and is a subset of top hierarchy level "Technology Class". A Process Class is defined by the device category and its generation or wafer diameter.

label: Process Flow
definition: A wafer technology is defined as a manufacturing process flow on wafer level including wafer test and pre-assembly which creates one device (discrete technology) or a set of different devices (IC technology) to be used in a product.

label: Process Group
definition: A Process Group is the third hierarchy level in the Technology Catalogue and a subset of the Process Class. A Process Group is defined by the device type and its generation (eventually voltage class) or wafer diameter

label: Process Line
definition: A Process Line is the forth hierarchy level in the Technology Catalogue and is a subset of Process Group. A Process Line is defined by WHAT is produced in detail

label: Product
definition: A product is a work product that is delivered to the customer.

label: Product
definition: A product is any tangible output or service that is a result of a process and that is intended for delivery to a customer or end user.

label: Product Class
definition: the product class is an entity used for planning and reporting. This helps create stable brand/name architectures to enable highest possible product portfolio transparency, true value creation ad to prevent from product TM overload.

label: Product Group
definition: A (main) product group is a grouping of products for calculation or sales purposes. The scope includes finished and unfinished products of one product line.

label: Product Level
definition: In the "product level" entity, the aggregation of elements enables the grouping of products and defines the relationship between products and groups at different hierarchy levels. This supports planning, logistics, modeling, forecasting and reporting.

label: Product Level 2
definition: The product levels 3 to 1 are aggregated levels that are based on information from product level 4. (hierarchal aggregation level)

label: Product Level 3
definition:
The static bottlenecks are determined in the “Product Level 3” master entity
because the mid capacity planning is done on this first aggregated product level. There is no big difference in capacity from the aggregated level 3 product to its child level 4 products. (hierarchal aggregation level)

label: Product Line
definition: The product line is one of the most prominent grouping of products. It is used in reporting as well as for structuring organizations.

label: Product Number
definition: The product number is a unique identifier of a product. The scope is limited to finished products only.

label: Production Request
definition: Production requests definte what the facilities need to produce when and in what quantity.

label: Productive
definition: The standard lots, also referred to as Productive (Prod) lots, are the most common lot type and have no priority.

label: Purge
definition: purge' is the application of an intert gas, or gas mixture, to the OD or ID surface of the weld joint to displace non-inert atmospheric gases. A block purge is a non-flowing purge with positive pressure.

label: Release Plan
definition: The “Release Plan” entity shows the quantity planned to be released to a fab or facility. (strategy entity)

label: Robot
definition: The robot loads and unloads the lots from the WIP station into the furnace. Robot can load the furnace while another boat is processd by the tool.

label: Rocket
definition: Rocket lots are processed immediately if a machine has free capacity. The remaining furnace space is then filled up with lots of the same product.

label: Route
definition: The master entity “Route” describes the structure of a workflow out of operations. Every product uses a specific route in its value stream, i.e. the complete sequence of operations with all mandatory and optional operations necessary to complete the product. A route makes use of the single operations. (workflow descriptive master entity)

label: Shift
definition: Each workshop has a certain technical and operational workforce organized in shifts described in the “Shift” entity.

label: Simulation Part
definition: A simulation part helps to identify the same product in different locations. They are visible in Product Structures. This is a simulation entity and not a form of production/planning.

label: Simulation Route
definition: A simulation route (AKA workroute) represents a sequence of process steps in manufacutring (mainly at wafer fab). This is a simulation entity and not a form of production/planning.

label: Sputtering
definition: The sputtering process, or physical vapor deposition (PVD) is the most used layering process today. Here gas atoms, mostly argon, strike out atoms from the cathode I an electric field which then form a thin film on the wafer surface.

label: Supply Chain
definition: The entity “Supply Chain” describes the supply chain from the topmost level with all possible material flow edges, referring on the FabIDs (master entity)

label: Supply Chain
definition: A SUPPLY CHAIN is the network of organizations, resources, activities, and technologies involved in the production and delivery of a product from raw materials to the final customer. Supply chain management issues have become increasingly important to the semiconductor industry due to the global distribution of facilities and its inherent long production time.

label: Target Costs
definition: The target costs entity is the final cost of a product or service that must be achieved in order to generate the desired level of sales revenue and income or due to contractual agreements.

label: Target Revenue
definition: The target revenue is the amount of income a company wants to generate for the current accounting period.

label: Target Service Level
definition: The target service level is a performance indicator expressing the percentage of orders satisfied.

label: Technology
definition: A semiconductor technology is a set of equipment, processes, manufacturing techniques and the related methods and procedures to enable the design & production of components, sub-components and modules.

label: Tempering
definition: The tempering process is a type of heat treatment applied by the furnace. The process has the effect of toughening by lessing brittleness and reducing internal stresses.

label: Time Constraints
definition: As single operations can set the lot to a time-critical state, time constraints can ensure that the operation setting it to an uncritical state is not delayed. Also the other case where certain time has to be spent between two operations can be covered with this master entity. (workflow deswcriptive master entities)

label: Time Coupling
definition: Lots of this type are requested by the next machine in the production line in irregular intervals. Special chemical characteristics require the lot being further processed immediately after the furnace operation. Thus, the downstram machines keep capacity free for the resulting time slot. timecoupling can be turned on or off. if it is on all lots are processed no matter how many are waiting and if not they wait.

label: Tool
definition: A tool is any pieve of semiconductor fabrication or inspection equipment designed to process wafers. Often used synonymously with equipment in the silicon wafer processing industry.

label: Wet Etching
definition: Wet Etching is the process of removing material-etching, through the use of chemical activity.

label: Work In Progress Station
definition: Work in Progress (WIP) processing occurs here. WIP refers to the units of production that have been released into the factory, but have not yet been scrapped, have not been sent our for external rework, and have not finished processing through all of the production steps.

label: Workshop
definition: The overall organizational working structures within the fabs is described in the entity “Workshop” (master entity)

label: Agent
definition:
"The Agent class is the class of agents; things that do stuff. A well known sub-class is Person, representing people. Other kinds of agents include Organization and Group.

The Agent class is useful in a few places in FOAF where Person would have been overly specific. For example, the IM chat ID properties such as jabberID are typically associated with people, but sometimes belong to software bots."

label: Document
definition: The foaf:Document class represents those things which are, broadly conceived, 'documents'

label: Person
definition: The Person class represents people. Something is a Person if it is a person. We don't nitpic about whether they're alive, dead, real, or imaginary. The Person class is a sub-class of the Agent class, since all people are considered 'agents' in FOAF.
